description: a(n)=n!-p, where p is the largest prime < (n!-1).
comments: Analogous to the lesser Fortunate numbers and like them, all entries so far are primes.
mathematica: PrevPrime[ n_Integer ] := (k=n-1; While[ !PrimeQ[ k ], k-- ]; Return[ k ]); f[ n_Integer ] := (p = n! - 1; q = NextPrime[ p ]; Return[ p - q + 1 ]); Table[ f[ n ], {n, 3, 75} ]f[n_]:=Module[{nf=n!},nf-NextPrime[nf-1,-1]];f/@Range[3,90]  (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 20 2011 *)
author: _Jud McCranie_
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jul 06 2000
